description: This aspect represents the estimated and actual delivery information of one specific item, which is being shipped from the supplier to the customer.

OrderIdCharacteristic.description: This is a proprietary order ID, generated by either the supplier side or customer side.

OrderPositionIdCharacteristic.description: The position ID is unique for an order and used within business context to refer to a position.

OrderPositionReferenceCharacteristic.description: The order position reference includes reference numbers for the order and the position. As these information are meant for the customer, the customer reference numbers are mandatory.

supplierOrderId.description: This is the order number on the supplier side that is given by e.g., the supplier's enterprise resource planning system.

customerOrderId.description: This is the order number on the customer side that can be given by e.g., the customer's enterprise resource planning system.

customerOrderPositionId.description: This is an identifier for the position of an order defined by the customer. It's not a technical identifier, such as an UUID. This identifier is used within the business context when talking about the position.

QuantityValueCharacteristic.description: The quantity value associated with the unit expressed as float.

QuantityCharacteristic.description: Describes the quantity and the unit of measure with which the delivery is measured.

value.description: The quantity value associated with the unit.

unit.description: The unit of an item. Common units may be related to mass, count, linear, area, volume or misc.

Timestamp.description: Describes a Property which contains the date and time with an optional timezone.

EventTypeEnumeration.description: Event type is the permutation of actual, estimated and departure, arrival.

TransitEvent.description: Entity for specifying the departure or arrival time and date.

dateTimeOfEvent.description: Time of Event signifies the time and date when the products leave (or will leave) the origin location of a delivery (i.e. supplier's production site) or when the products arrive (or will arrive) at the destination location of the delivery (i.e. customer's production site).

eventType.description: Event type describes whether the mentioned timeOfEvent refers to a departure or arrival and provides the status of the delivery (estimated or actual).

TransitEventsTrait.description: The TransitEventsSet MUST contain either 1 or 2 TransitEvents.

BpnaTrait.description: The provided regular expression ensures that the BPNA is composed of prefix 'BPNA', 10 digits and two alphanumeric letters.

BpnsTrait.description: The provided regular expression ensures that the BPNS is composed of prefix 'BPNS', 10 digits and two alphanumeric letters.

LocationCharacteristic.description: Location characteristic describes a particular location of a business partner. It MUST include the information of the site and it MAY include the exact address.

TransitLocationsCharacteristic.description: Transit locations includes origin and destination points in the transportation of goods. It refers to specific location of the source or production facility (origin) or the designated endpoint (destination).

origin.description: Origin refers to the starting point or the location from which the items are being shipped to the customer.

destination.description: Destination refers to the final endpoint or intended location where the items are meant to arrive (i.e. customer factory).

TrackingNumberCharacteristic.description: Alphanumeric string that is defined by the logistics service provider in order to track and identify the shipment.

IncotermEnumeration.description: All 12 possible values for the incoterms.

Delivery.description: Quantity, origin and destination, time of departure and arrival, tracking number and incoterms for a certain delivery.

deliveryQuantity.description: Amount of items of a delivery between a supplier and a customer.

lastUpdatedOnDateTime.description: Date and time at which the delivery has been updated by the data provider. Date and time are set according to the timezone.

transitEvents.description: Transit dates provide date and time of departure and date and time of arrival for a specific delivery. Date and time are set according to the timezone.

transitLocations.description: Physical locations of the origin and destination.

trackingNumber.description: Is a unique alphanumeric code assigned to a shipment by a logistics service provider, allowing it to be monitored and traced throughout its journey between origin and destination.

incoterm.description: Incoterm which is assigned to a delivery.

DeliverySet.description: Set of deliveries that may relate to different origin or destination, different quantities and different time of departure or time of arrival. It MAY include different tracking numbers and different incoterms.

Position.description: The Position can contain one or more deliveries involving one or more supplier's and one or more customer's sites. A position may be anonymous (no orderPositionReference is set) or may reference a position within an order.

orderPositionReference.description: The order position reference contains information to identify a position within an order.

deliveries.description: Deliveries are referred to the deliveries of an order position. One order position can be split into multiple deliveries. One delivery can have a different origin and destination than another delivery.

PositionsSet.description: If any delivery for the customer is estimated, then there is at least one position. If each order position is assigned to one (or more) delivery (an OrderPositionReference is set), then multiple positions can be given.

UuidV4Trait.description: The provided regular expression ensures that the UUID is composed of five groups of characters separated by hyphens, in the form 8-4-4-4-12 for a total of 36 characters (32 hexadecimal characters and 4 hyphens), optionally prefixed by "urn:uuid:" to make it an IRI.

positions.description: The positions refer to positions within an order of the given item (see material number supplier, material number customer and material global asset ID) for which the delivery information is exchanged. The positions can be differentiated by the order position reference. If no order position reference is given, then there is only one position containing all estimated deliveries of the item.

materialGlobalAssetId.description: Identifier used uniquely to identify part type twin.
